description:
The Production Supervisor is responsible for the supervision of the department work area, including the use of equipment and safety. In partnership with other company Supervisors, this position will develop and execute department goals and objectives as they relate to safety, production, quality, shipping and receiving. Supervises all functions of the work area including safety and training

  • Manages hourly workforce in designated department and workflow of production lines
  • Schedules production lines, maintains and improves productivity
  • Maintains accurate computerized inventory control and cycle counts
  • Develops and maintains performance measurements and work schedules
  • Provides training to direct reports in the areas of production, material handling, equipment, safety and hazardous materials
  • Sorts and disposes of non-conforming materials in accordance with established procedures
  • Maintains the production area in good housekeeping order according to OSHA guidelines
  • Adheres to and promotes all company safety rules and requirements
  • Performs other duties as required. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Supervises hourly workforce within the department and is responsible for the performance management and hiring for the position(s).
  • Coach, mentor, and develop hourly workforce
  • Provide mentoring and training for production, safety, quality, inventory control etc salary: $72,000 - $80,000 per year shift: First work hours: 8 AM - 4 PM education: High School

Responsibilities

The Production Supervisor is responsible for the supervision of the department work area, including the use of equipment and safety.

In partnership with other company Supervisors, this position will develop and execute department goals and objectives as they relate to safety, production, quality, shipping and receiving.

Supervises all functions of the work area including safety and training

  • Manages hourly workforce in designated department and workflow of production lines
  • Schedules production lines, maintains and improves productivity
  • Maintains accurate computerized inventory control and cycle counts
  • Develops and maintains performance measurements and work schedules
  • Provides training to direct reports in the areas of production, material handling, equipment, safety and hazardous materials
  • Sorts and disposes of non-conforming materials in accordance with established procedures
  • Maintains the production area in good housekeeping order according to OSHA guidelines
  • Adheres to and promotes all company safety rules and requirements
  • Performs other duties as required.

Supervisory Responsibilities

  • Supervises hourly workforce within the department and is responsible for the performance management and hiring for the position(s).
  • Coach, mentor, and develop hourly workforce
  • Provide mentoring and training for production, safety, quality, inventory control etc

The Essential Functions Of This Role Include

  • manual lifting up to 40lbs
  • standing for 8 hours at one time

Skills

  • Manufacturing
  • Production Control
  • Operations
  • Line Management

Qualifications

  • Years of experience: 2 years
  • Experience level: Manager
